channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: GM-TCNet: Gated Multi-scale Temporal Convolutional Network using Emotion Causality for Speech Emotion Recognition
item.description: In this paper, we propose a Gated Multi-scale Temporal Convolutional Network (GM-TCNet) to construct a novel emotional causality representation learning component with a multi-scale receptive field.

item.title: Towards Few-Shot Open-Set Object Detection
item.description: We seek a solution for few-shot open-set object detection (FSOSOD), which aims to quickly train a detector based on few samples while detecting all known classes and identifying unknown classes.

item.title: Domain Generalization through the Lens of Angular Invariance
item.description: Based on the proposed term of invariance, we propose a novel deep DG method called Angular Invariance Domain Generalization Network (AIDGN).

item.title: Bi-Directional Iterative Prompt-Tuning for Event Argument Extraction
item.description: Recently, prompt-tuning has attracted growing interests in event argument extraction (EAE).

item.title: Towards Trustworthy Multi-Modal Motion Prediction: Evaluation and Interpretability
item.description: First, we comprehensively analyse the evaluation metrics, identify the main gaps of current benchmarks, and propose a new holistic evaluation framework.

item.title: Stop Measuring Calibration When Humans Disagree
item.description: Calibration is a popular framework to evaluate whether a classifier knows when it does not know - i. e., its predictive probabilities are a good indication of how likely a prediction is to be correct.

item.title: RESUS: Warm-Up Cold Users via Meta-Learning Residual User Preferences in CTR Prediction
item.description: Specifically, we employ a shared predictor to infer basis user preferences, which acquires global preference knowledge from the interactions of different users.

item.title: cRedAnno+: Annotation Exploitation in Self-Explanatory Lung Nodule Diagnosis
item.description: Recently, attempts have been made to reduce annotation requirements in feature-based self-explanatory models for lung nodule diagnosis.

item.title: Risk-Aware Bid Optimization for Online Display Advertisement
item.description: This research focuses on the bid optimization problem in the real-time bidding setting for online display advertisements, where an advertiser, or the advertiser's agent, has access to the features of the website visitor and the type of ad slots, to decide the optimal bid prices given a predetermined total advertisement budget.

item.title: On the Use of Modality-Specific Large-Scale Pre-Trained Encoders for Multimodal Sentiment Analysis
item.description: This paper investigates the effectiveness and implementation of modality-specific large-scale pre-trained encoders for multimodal sentiment analysis~(MSA).

item.title: Vox-Fusion: Dense Tracking and Mapping with Voxel-based Neural Implicit Representation
item.description: In this work, we present a dense tracking and mapping system named Vox-Fusion, which seamlessly fuses neural implicit representations with traditional volumetric fusion methods.

item.title: Object Segmentation of Cluttered Airborne LiDAR Point Clouds
item.description: Airborne topographic LiDAR is an active remote sensing technology that emits near-infrared light to map objects on the Earth's surface.

item.title: DORE: Document Ordered Relation Extraction based on Generative Framework
item.description: In this paper, we investigate the root cause of the underwhelming performance of the existing generative DocRE models and discover that the culprit is the inadequacy of the training paradigm, instead of the capacities of the models.

item.title: Improving Zero-Shot Multilingual Translation with Universal Representations and Cross-Mappings
item.description: The many-to-many multilingual neural machine translation can translate between language pairs unseen during training, i. e., zero-shot translation.

item.title: Contextual Learning in Fourier Complex Field for VHR Remote Sensing Images
item.description: By stacking various layers of CSA blocks, we propose the Fourier Complex Transformer (FCT) model to learn global contextual information from VHR aerial images following the hierarchical manners.

item.title: Goal Exploration Augmentation via Pre-trained Skills for Sparse-Reward Long-Horizon Goal-Conditioned Reinforcement Learning
item.description: In GCRL, exploring novel sub-goals is essential for the agent to ultimately find the pathway to the desired goal.

item.title: Benchmarking performance of object detection under image distortions in an uncontrolled environment
item.description: In this study, we present a performance evaluation framework for the state-of-the-art object detection methods using a dedicated dataset containing images with various distortions at different levels of severity.

item.title: NNSVS: A Neural Network-Based Singing Voice Synthesis Toolkit
item.description: This paper describes the design of NNSVS, an open-source software for neural network-based singing voice synthesis research.

item.title: Self-Supervised Learning with Multi-View Rendering for 3D Point Cloud Analysis
item.description: Inspired by the success of deep learning in the image domain, we devise a novel pre-training technique for better model initialization by utilizing the multi-view rendering of the 3D data.

item.title: Latent Space is Feature Space: Regularization Term for GANs Training on Limited Dataset
item.description: However, a large amount of data is required, or the model would prone to generate images with similar patterns (mode collapse) and bad quality.

item.title: Improving Lipschitz-Constrained Neural Networks by Learning Activation Functions
item.description: Lipschitz-constrained neural networks have several advantages compared to unconstrained ones and can be applied to various different problems.

item.title: Data-driven discovery of Green's functions
item.description: Finally, theoretical results on Green's functions and rational NNs are combined to design a human-understandable deep learning method for discovering Green's functions from data.

item.title: Distributed Optimal Control of Graph Symmetric Systems via Graph Filters
item.description: Designing distributed optimal controllers subject to communication constraints is a difficult problem unless structural assumptions are imposed on the underlying dynamics and information exchange structure, e. g., sparsity, delay, or spatial invariance.

item.title: Are Neural Topic Models Broken?
item.description: Recently, the relationship between automated and human evaluation of topic models has been called into question.

item.title: Complex Handwriting Trajectory Recovery: Evaluation Metrics and Algorithm
item.description: Many important tasks such as forensic signature verification, calligraphy synthesis, etc, rely on handwriting trajectory recovery of which, however, even an appropriate evaluation metric is still missing.

item.title: Understanding Adverse Biological Effect Predictions Using Knowledge Graphs
item.description: An effect prediction model, with and without background knowledge, was used to predict mean adverse biological effect concentration of chemicals as a prototypical type of stressors.

item.title: Leveraging Label Correlations in a Multi-label Setting: A Case Study in Emotion
item.description: First, we develop two modeling approaches to the problem in order to capture word associations of the emotion words themselves, by either including the emotions in the input, or by leveraging Masked Language Modeling (MLM).

item.title: Exploring Spatial-Temporal Features for Deepfake Detection and Localization
item.description: In this work, we propose a Spatial-Temporal Deepfake Detection and Localization (ST-DDL) network that simultaneously explores spatial and temporal features for detecting and localizing forged regions.

item.title: Differentiable Analog Quantum Computing for Optimization and Control
item.description: We formulate the first differentiable analog quantum computing framework with a specific parameterization design at the analog signal (pulse) level to better exploit near-term quantum devices via variational methods.

item.title: RoChBert: Towards Robust BERT Fine-tuning for Chinese
item.description: Despite of the superb performance on a wide range of tasks, pre-trained language models (e. g., BERT) have been proved vulnerable to adversarial texts.

item.title: VLT: Vision-Language Transformer and Query Generation for Referring Segmentation
item.description: We propose a Vision-Language Transformer (VLT) framework for referring segmentation to facilitate deep interactions among multi-modal information and enhance the holistic understanding to vision-language features.

item.title: Emergence of sector and spiral patterns from a two-species mutualistic cross-feeding model
item.description: Focusing on the interplay among nutrient diffusion and individual cell division, we discover three general classes of colony morphology: co-existing sectors, co-existing spirals, and engulfment.

item.title: Spectrograms Are Sequences of Patches
item.description: Self-supervised pre-training models have been used successfully in several machine learning domains.

item.title: Preferential Subsampling for Stochastic Gradient Langevin Dynamics
item.description: Stochastic gradient MCMC (SGMCMC) offers a scalable alternative to traditional MCMC, by constructing an unbiased estimate of the gradient of the log-posterior with a small, uniformly-weighted subsample of the data.

item.title: Lightweight and High-Fidelity End-to-End Text-to-Speech with Multi-Band Generation and Inverse Short-Time Fourier Transform
item.description: We propose a lightweight end-to-end text-to-speech model using multi-band generation and inverse short-time Fourier transform.

item.title: ERNIE-ViLG 2.0: Improving Text-to-Image Diffusion Model with Knowledge-Enhanced Mixture-of-Denoising-Experts
item.description: Recent progress in diffusion models has revolutionized the popular technology of text-to-image generation.

item.title: Neural Networks with Quantization Constraints
item.description: Furthermore, we show that dual variables indicate the sensitivity of the objective with respect to constraint perturbations.

item.title: Revisiting the ACVI Method for Constrained Variational Inequalities
item.description: In this work, we show that the same guarantee holds when only assuming that the operator is monotone.

item.title: Domain Adaptive Object Detection for Autonomous Driving under Foggy Weather
item.description: This paper proposes a novel domain adaptive object detection framework for autonomous driving under foggy weather.

item.title: Watermarking for Out-of-distribution Detection
item.description: Out-of-distribution (OOD) detection aims to identify OOD data based on representations extracted from well-trained deep models.

item.title: COST-EFF: Collaborative Optimization of Spatial and Temporal Efficiency with Slenderized Multi-exit Language Models
item.description: Motivated by such considerations, we propose a collaborative optimization for PLMs that integrates static model compression and dynamic inference acceleration.

item.title: Deep Convolutional Neural Networks for Multi-Target Tracking: A Transfer Learning Approach
item.description: We represent the target states and sensor measurements as images.

item.title: Towards Complex Backgrounds: A Unified Difference-Aware Decoder for Binary Segmentation
item.description: In Stage A, the first branch decoder of the difference-aware decoder is used to obtain a guide map.

item.title: MorphTE: Injecting Morphology in Tensorized Embeddings
item.description: In the era of deep learning, word embeddings are essential when dealing with text tasks.

item.title: Segmentation of Multiple Sclerosis Lesions across Hospitals: Learn Continually or Train from Scratch?
item.description: Segmentation of Multiple Sclerosis (MS) lesions is a challenging problem.

item.title: Bootstrapping Human Optical Flow and Pose
item.description: We propose a bootstrapping framework to enhance human optical flow and pose.

item.title: Articulation GAN: Unsupervised modeling of articulatory learning
item.description: Articulatory analysis of the generated EMA representations suggests that the network learns to control articulators in a manner that closely follows human articulators during speech production.

item.title: Modeling Inter-Dependence Between Time and Mark in Multivariate Temporal Point Processes
item.description: In this work, we model the conditional inter-dependence of time and mark to overcome the limitations of conditionally independent models.

item.title: Dictionary-Assisted Supervised Contrastive Learning
item.description: Text analysis in the social sciences often involves using specialized dictionaries to reason with abstract concepts, such as perceptions about the economy or abuse on social media.

item.title: Opening the Black Box of wav2vec Feature Encoder
item.description: Self-supervised models, namely, wav2vec and its variants, have shown promising results in various downstream tasks in the speech domain.
